AWS wav capture uses tokens to track
successful responses to captcha to
summarize when a client makes a request
without a token AWS Waf presents a
captcha when a user solves the captcha
AWS automatically generates and encrypts
capture token and sends it to the client
as a cookie then when the client sends a
request it includes the encrypted
capture token in the request and as
needed AWS wath automatically decrypts
the token and verifies that it's invalid
captcha token the token itself will
include the timestamp and the last
successful response to the captcha after
a user successfully solves a captcha the
client requests aren't challenged again
until the rule with captcha action
determines that the token has expired so
how long until a token is expired well

example if you plan to have a capture

could consider adding a second rate base
